Certainly! Here's an updated version that includes the fun fact:

Your first stop should be the Garden of Eden. Not only is it a great way to stretch your legs, but this botanical garden is also home to some of the most exotic plants and flowers in the world. Did you know that the Garden of Eden was used as a filming location for the opening scene of the TV series "Fantasy Island"? It's easy to see why with its lush greenery, waterfalls, and stunning ocean views. You and your pet can stroll along the garden paths and take in the picturesque scenery. Keep an eye out for the rainbow eucalyptus trees, a particularly unique and colorful attraction.

From there, make your way to the Twin Falls. These gorgeous waterfalls are only a short hike from the parking lot and offer a refreshing dip in the cool water. If you're feeling adventurous, take a dip with your furry friend in the swimming holes at the base of the falls.

Another must-see stop is the town of Hana itself, where you can learn about the history and culture of the area. Visit the Hana Cultural Center and Museum to see exhibits on local traditions and history, or take a stroll around the town to see the historic buildings and churches.

Last but not least, make sure to visit Wai'anapanapa State Park. This stunning black sand beach is surrounded by towering cliffs and lush greenery, offering a truly unique and unforgettable experience. Take a stroll along the beach, explore the nearby caves, or simply relax with your pet and take in the stunning views.
